parameters.name: Config_opt
parameters.description: Configuration options as defined by swInConfigurationOpts_e

parameters.name: Config_names
parameters.description: Array of configuration names of size Config_count

title: IFeature.IGetMaterialPropertyValues2
description: Gets the material property values for this feature in the specified configurations.
signature:
System.Double IGetMaterialPropertyValues2( 
   System.Int32
Config_opt
,
   System.Int32
Config_count
,
   ref System.String
Config_names
)

parameters.name: Config_opt
parameters.description: Configuration options as defined by swInConfigurationOpts_e

parameters.name: Config_names
parameters.description: Array of configuration names of size Config_count

returns: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of doubles (see Remarks ) VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.
remarks:
The material values returned include the face color (R,G,B values), reflectivity (ambient, diffuse, specular, shininess), transparency, and emission. Valid values are between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, for all material properties. If a return value is -1, then that material property was not set for this feature.
If you set Config_opt to swThisConfiguration or swAllConfiguration, then Config_names
is ignored.
The format of the returned array:
[
R, G, B, Ambient, Diffuse, Specular, Shininess, Transparency, Emission
]
* Config_count
